data.content:
verb
also Brit galvanise -nizes; -nized; -nizing
[+ obj] to cause (people) to become so excited or concerned about an issue, idea, etc., that they want to do something about it
an issue that galvanized the public (to take action)
to cause (a force that is capable of causing change) to become active
The group is hoping to galvanize public opinion against the proposed law.
The Web site has galvanized support for the project.
technical :to cover (steel or iron) with a layer of zinc to prevent it from rusting
a factory where steel is galvanized

cách viết khác galvanise
Động từ
mạ kẽm
galvanized wire
dây kim loại mạ kẽm
galvanize (somebody) into something (into doing something)
khích động ai
the announcement of the general election galvanized the party members into activity
tin loan báo sắp có tổng tuyển cử đã khích động các đảng viên hoạt động mạnh lên
